testimony.name: Bernadette Ferrara
key_points: The majority of Bronx Community Boards (7 out of 11) have voted against the initiative
The initiative is a deregulatory program that will increase density in low-density neighborhoods
The proposals will damage neighborhoods throughout the city, especially in the Bronx
The initiative will burden specific Bronx neighborhoods with new shelters and up-zoning proposals
The proposal shifts decision-making away from communities and city council to commissioners
Suggests addressing warehoused rent-stabilized apartments as an alternative solution
Opposes the reintroduction of SROs (Single Room Occupancy)
Believes the initiative benefits developers, not communities
Urges commissioners to vote against the initiative due to its many components
